t: Ezekiel 30
Lament over Egypt
The*p word of the Lord*s came again to me saying,
“Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord God,*s “Wail,*pn ‘Alas for the day!’
For*ln the day is near, Even*ln the day of the Lord*s is near; It*ln will be a day of clouds, A*ln time of*i doom*i for the nations.
A*ln sword will come upon Egypt, And*ln anguish will be in Ethiopia; When*ln the slain fall in Egypt, They*ln take away her wealth, And*ln her foundations are torn down.
Ethiopia,*p Put, Lud, all Arabia, Libya and the people of the land that is in league will fall with them by the sword.”

‘Thus*pn says the Lord,*s “Indeed,*ln those who support Egypt will fall And*ln the pride of her power will come down; From*ln Migdol to*i Syene They*ln will fall within her by the sword,” Declares*ln the Lord God.*s
“They*ln will be desolate In*ln the midst of the desolated lands; And*ln her cities will be In*ln the midst of the devastated cities.
And*ln they will know that I am the Lord,*s When*ln I set a fire in Egypt And*ln all her helpers are broken.
On*p that day messengers will go forth from Me in ships to frighten secure Ethiopia; and anguish will be on them as on the day of Egypt; for behold, it comes!”
‘Thus*p says the Lord God,*s “I*pn will also make the hordes of Egypt cease By*ln the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
He*ln and his people with him, The*ln most ruthless of the nations, Will*ln be brought in to destroy the land; And*ln they will draw their swords against Egypt And*ln fill the land with the slain.

Moreover,*ln I will make the Nile canals dry And*ln sell the land into the hands of evil men. And*ln I will make the land desolate And*ln all that is in it, By*ln the hand of strangers; I the Lord*s have spoken.”

‘Thus*p says the Lord God,*s “I*pn will also destroy the idols And*ln make the images cease from Memphis. And*ln there will no longer be a prince in the land of Egypt; And*ln I will put fear in the land of Egypt.
I*ln will make Pathros desolate, Set*ln a fire in Zoan And*ln execute judgments on Thebes.
I*ln will pour out My wrath on Sin, The*ln stronghold of Egypt; I*ln will also cut off the hordes of Thebes.
I*ln will set a fire in Egypt; Sin*ln will writhe in anguish, Thebes*ln will be breached And*ln Memphis will*i have*i distresses daily.
The*ln young men of On and of Pi-beseth Will*ln fall by the sword, And*ln the women will go into captivity.

In*ln Tehaphnehes the day will be dark When*ln I break there the yoke bars of Egypt. Then*ln the pride of her power will cease in her; A*ln cloud will cover her, And*ln her daughters will go into captivity.
Thus*ln I will execute judgments on Egypt, And*ln they will know that I am the Lord*s .” ’ ”
Victory for Babylon
In*p the eleventh year, in the first month,*i on the seventh of the month, the word of the Lord*s came to me saying,
“Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and, behold, it has not been bound up for healing or wrapped with a bandage, that it may be strong to hold the sword.
Therefore thus says the Lord God,*s ‘Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt and will break his arms, both the strong and the broken; and I will make the sword fall from his hand.
I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them among the lands.
For I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put My sword in his hand; and I will break the arms of Pharaoh, so that he will groan before him with the groanings of a wounded man.

Thus I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh will fall. Then they will know that I am the Lord,*s when I put My sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he stretches it out against the land of Egypt.
When I scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them among the lands, then they will know that I am the Lord*s .’ ”
